trans-unit.source: List Containers
trans-unit.target: List Containers

trans-unit.source: List Containers
trans-unit.target: List Containers

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns a list of the containers under the specified account.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns a list of the containers under the specified account.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account:

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.
trans-unit.target: Note that the URI must always include the forward slash (/) to separate the host name from the path and query portions of the URI.

trans-unit.source: In the case of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, the path portion of the URI is empty.
trans-unit.target: In the case of the <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation, the path portion of the URI is empty.

trans-unit.source: Emulated Storage Service Request
trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service Request

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Blob service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10000</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Note that emulated storage only supports blob sizes up to 2 GB.
trans-unit.target: Note that emulated storage only supports blob sizes up to 2 GB.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f0e3acde-f019-4148-9544-34cf2ff27211" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="c60f2090-c0f4-4817-8559-e98786461dbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Differences Between the Storage Emulator and Azure Storage Services</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="f0e3acde-f019-4148-9544-34cf2ff27211" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Using the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing</legacyLink> and <legacyLink xlink:href="c60f2090-c0f4-4817-8559-e98786461dbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Differences Between the Storage Emulator and Azure Storage Services</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.
trans-unit.target: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Filters the results to return only containers whose name begins with the specified prefix.
trans-unit.target: Filters the results to return only containers whose name begins with the specified prefix.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A string value that identifies the portion of the list to be returned with the next list operation.
trans-unit.target: A string value that identifies the portion of the list to be returned with the next list operation.

trans-unit.source: The operation returns a marker value within the response body if the list returned was not complete.
trans-unit.target: The operation returns a marker value within the response body if the list returned was not complete.

trans-unit.source: The marker value may then be used in a subsequent call to request the next set of list items.
trans-unit.target: The marker value may then be used in a subsequent call to request the next set of list items.

trans-unit.source: The marker value is opaque to the client.
trans-unit.target: The marker value is opaque to the client.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the maximum number of containers to return.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the maximum number of containers to return.

trans-unit.source: If the request does not specify <parameterReference>maxresults</parameterReference>, or specifies a value greater than 5,000, the server will return up to 5,000 items.
trans-unit.target: If the request does not specify <parameterReference>maxresults</parameterReference>, or specifies a value greater than 5,000, the server will return up to 5,000 items.

trans-unit.source: If the parameter is set to a value less than or equal to zero, the server will return status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If the parameter is set to a value less than or equal to zero, the server will return status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Include this parameter to specify that the container's metadata be returned as part of the response body.
trans-unit.target: Include this parameter to specify that the container's metadata be returned as part of the response body.

trans-unit.source: Note that metadata requested with this parameter must be stored in accordance with the naming restrictions imposed by the 2009-09-19 version of the Blob service.
trans-unit.target: Note that metadata requested with this parameter must be stored in accordance with the naming restrictions imposed by the 2009-09-19 version of the Blob service.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with this version, all metadata names must adhere to the naming conventions for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670(VS.71).aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with this version, all metadata names must adhere to the naming conventions for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670(VS.71).aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="9ae411fa-1495-42a0-bc26-c41ebca9d5b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="9ae411fa-1495-42a0-bc26-c41ebca9d5b8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for Blob Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.

trans-unit.source: Required for all authenticated requests.
trans-unit.target: Required for all authenticated requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body in XML format.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body in XML format.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.target: The response also includes additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response header
trans-unit.target: Response header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Standard HTTP/1.1 header.
trans-unit.target: Standard HTTP/1.1 header.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the format in which the results are returned.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the format in which the results are returned.

trans-unit.source: Currently, this value is application/xml.
trans-unit.target: Currently, this value is application/xml.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Blob service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and above.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The format of the response body is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The format of the response body is as follows.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>LeaseStatus</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>LeaseState</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>LeaseDuration</languageKeyword> only appear in version 2012-02-12 and later.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>LeaseStatus</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>LeaseState</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>LeaseDuration</languageKeyword> only appear in version 2012-02-12 and later.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, the <languageKeyword>AccountName</languageKeyword> attribute for the <languageKeyword>EnumerationResults</languageKeyword> element has been renamed to <languageKeyword>ServiceEndpoint</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2013-08-15, the <languageKeyword>AccountName</languageKeyword> attribute for the <languageKeyword>EnumerationResults</languageKeyword> element has been renamed to <languageKeyword>ServiceEndpoint</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>URL</languageKeyword> element has also been removed from the <languageKeyword>Container</languageKeyword> element.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>URL</languageKeyword> element has also been removed from the <languageKeyword>Container</languageKeyword> element.

trans-unit.source: For versions prior to 2013-08-15, the container's URL, as specified by the <languageKeyword>URL</languageKeyword> field, does not include the <parameterReference>restype=container</parameterReference> parameter.
trans-unit.target: For versions prior to 2013-08-15, the container's URL, as specified by the <languageKeyword>URL</languageKeyword> field, does not include the <parameterReference>restype=container</parameterReference> parameter.

trans-unit.source: If you use this value to make subsequent requests against the enumerated containers, be sure to append this parameter to indicate that the resource type is a container.
trans-unit.target: If you use this value to make subsequent requests against the enumerated containers, be sure to append this parameter to indicate that the resource type is a container.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Prefix</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Marker</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>MaxResults</languageKeyword> elements are only present if they were specified on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Prefix</languageKeyword>, <languageKeyword>Marker</languageKeyword>, and <languageKeyword>MaxResults</languageKeyword> elements are only present if they were specified on the URI.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> element has a value only if the list results are not complete.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> element has a value only if the list results are not complete.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Metadata</languageKeyword> element is present only if the <parameterReference>include=metadata</parameterReference> parameter was specified on the URI.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Metadata</languageKeyword> element is present only if the <parameterReference>include=metadata</parameterReference> parameter was specified on the URI.

trans-unit.source: Within the <languageKeyword>Metadata</languageKeyword> element, the value of each name-value pair is listed within an element corresponding to the pair's name.
trans-unit.target: Within the <languageKeyword>Metadata</languageKeyword> element, the value of each name-value pair is listed within an element corresponding to the pair's name.

trans-unit.source: If a metadata name-value pair violates the naming restrictions enforced by the 2009-09-19 version, the response body indicates the problematic name within an <languageKeyword>x-ms-invalid-name</languageKeyword> element, as shown in the following XML fragment:
trans-unit.target: If a metadata name-value pair violates the naming restrictions enforced by the 2009-09-19 version, the response body indicates the problematic name within an <languageKeyword>x-ms-invalid-name</languageKeyword> element, as shown in the following XML fragment:

trans-unit.source: Beginning with version 2009-09-19, the response body for <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns the container's last modified time in an element named <languageKeyword>Last-Modified</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with version 2009-09-19, the response body for <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> returns the container's last modified time in an element named <languageKeyword>Last-Modified</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions, this element was named <languageKeyword>LastModified</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: In previous versions, this element was named <languageKeyword>LastModified</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#samplerequestandresponse" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample Request and Response</legacyLink> section later in this topic.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#samplerequestandresponse" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sample Request and Response</legacyLink> section later in this topic.

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a value for the <parameterReference>maxresults</parameterReference> parameter and the number of containers to return exceeds this value, or exceeds the default value for <parameterReference>maxresults</parameterReference>, the response body will contain a <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> element that indicates the next container to return on a subsequent request.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a value for the <parameterReference>maxresults</parameterReference> parameter and the number of containers to return exceeds this value, or exceeds the default value for <parameterReference>maxresults</parameterReference>, the response body will contain a <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> element that indicates the next container to return on a subsequent request.

trans-unit.source: To return the next set of items, specify the value of <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> as the marker parameter on the URI for the subsequent request.
trans-unit.target: To return the next set of items, specify the value of <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> as the marker parameter on the URI for the subsequent request.

trans-unit.source: Note that the value of <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> should be treated as opaque.
trans-unit.target: Note that the value of <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> should be treated as opaque.

trans-unit.source: Containers are listed in alphabetical order in the response body.
trans-unit.target: Containers are listed in alphabetical order in the response body.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation times out after 30 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>List Containers</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation times out after 30 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Sample Request and Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Request and Response

trans-unit.source: The following sample URI requests the list of containers for an account, setting the maximum results to return for the initial operation to 3.
trans-unit.target: The following sample URI requests the list of containers for an account, setting the maximum results to return for the initial operation to 3.

trans-unit.source: The request is sent with these headers:
trans-unit.target: The request is sent with these headers:

trans-unit.source: The status code and response headers are returned as follows:
trans-unit.target: The status code and response headers are returned as follows:

trans-unit.source: The response XML for this request is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The response XML for this request is as follows.

trans-unit.source: Note that the <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> element follows the set of containers and includes the name of the next container to be returned.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <languageKeyword>NextMarker</languageKeyword> element follows the set of containers and includes the name of the next container to be returned.

trans-unit.source: The subsequent list operation specifies the marker on the request URI, as follows.
trans-unit.target: The subsequent list operation specifies the marker on the request URI, as follows.

trans-unit.source: The next set of results is returned beginning with the container specified by the marker.
trans-unit.target: The next set of results is returned beginning with the container specified by the marker.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Storage Emulator for Development and Testing
